text.div:
BC AnatomicalLocation Logical Model

A location or structure in the body, including tissues, regions, cavities, and spaces, for example, right elbow, or left ventricle of the heart. Note: In CIMI Version 0.0.4, AnatomicalLocation has no parent class. This appears to have been an oversight, and the parent should have been Entity, as modeled here. This class corresponds to that CIMI reference model class, but it would be defined in a CIMI archetype, because it involves value set bindings on each of the attributes.

name: AnatomicalLocation
title: BC AnatomicalLocation Logical Model
publisher: The HL7 Cancer Interoperability Group sponsored by Clinical Interoperability Council Work Group (CIC).
description:
A location or structure in the body, including tissues, regions, cavities, and spaces, for example, right elbow, or left ventricle of the heart.

Note: In CIMI Version 0.0.4, AnatomicalLocation has no parent class. This appears to have been an oversight, and the parent should have been Entity, as modeled here. This class corresponds to that CIMI reference model class, but it would be defined in a CIMI archetype, because it involves value set bindings on each of the attributes.

element.definition:
A location or structure in the body, including tissues, regions, cavities, and spaces, for example, right elbow, or left ventricle of the heart.

Note: In CIMI Version 0.0.4, AnatomicalLocation has no parent class. This appears to have been an oversight, and the parent should have been Entity, as modeled here. This class corresponds to that CIMI reference model class, but it would be defined in a CIMI archetype, because it involves value set bindings on each of the attributes.

element.short: Code representing a location or structure in the body, including tissues, regions, cavities, and spaces, for example, right elbow, or left ventricle of the heart.
element.definition:
Code representing a location or structure in the body, including tissues, regions, cavities, and spaces, for example, right elbow, or left ventricle of the heart.

Note: In CIMI Version 0.0.4, AnatomicalLocation has no parent class. This appears to have been an oversight, and the parent should have been Entity, as modeled here. This class corresponds to that CIMI reference model class, but it would be defined in a CIMI archetype, because it involves value set bindings on each of the attributes.

element.short: Anatomical location or specimen further detailing the side(s) of interest.
element.definition: Anatomical location or specimen further detailing the side(s) of interest.

element.short: Anatomical location or specimen further detailing directionality.
element.definition:
Anatomical location or specimen further detailing directionality.
	Note: In CIMI Version 0.0.4, this is called anatomicalDirection.

element.short: Further detail of the anatomical location or specimen detailing whether it includes the entire entity or only a part or portion. NOTE: This attribute is not part of CIMI. It was included because it further details an anatomical location or specimen, in Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium (CDISC) Study Data Tabulation Model (SDTM).
element.definition: Further detail of the anatomical location or specimen detailing whether it includes the entire entity or only a part or portion. NOTE: This attribute is not part of CIMI. It was included because it further details an anatomical location or specimen, in Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium (CDISC) Study Data Tabulation Model (SDTM).
